Smoothed-particle hydrodynamics (SPH) code

Developer Guide

  • boost smart pointers http://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_43_0/libs/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.html 
    #include <cstdlib>
#include <iostream>
//#include <boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp>
#include <boost/smart_ptr/make_shared.hpp>
class A {
public: 
  A() {
    std::cerr << "constructor of A\n";
  }
  A(const int n) {
    std::cerr << "constructor of A with n=" << n << " called\n";
  }
  ~A() {
    std::cerr << "destructor of A\n";
  }
  void say() const {
    std::cerr << "(A.say) I am object of A class\n";
  }
};

int main() {
  // crate a shared pointer to an object of A class
  boost::shared_ptr<A> spa1 = boost::make_shared<A>();
  spa1->say();
  boost::shared_ptr<A> spa2 = boost::make_shared<A>(42);
  spa2->say();
  // overwrite a pointer 
  spa2 = boost::make_shared<A>();
  // at this point destructor is called 
  // because there are no references to 
  // the object
  spa2->say();
  return EXIT_SUCCESS;
}

  • BOOST_FOREACH for iterations http://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_43_0/doc/html/foreach.html

  • TCL for configuration files (see sph-blitz/cases/) http://www.tcl.tk/man/tcl/tutorial/tcltutorial.html

  • google logging http://google-glog.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/doc/glog.html Log files are stored in /tmp/ directory. The symbolic links /tmp/sph.WARNING /tmp/sph.INFO point to the last log files. Use 
      tail -f /tmp/sph.INFO
    to follow the output 
      GLOG_logtostderr=1 ./sph <project name>
    sends all logging messages to stderr and they can be seen in the text terminal.

  • To add a new file: add the name to the list in sph-blitz/src/Makefile.am Run 
      ./bootstrap.sh
    in sph-blitz directory
